alternative_title: Making a RIDDOR report to the HSE
introduction: Report accidents, near misses and work-related illnesses and diseases using the Health and Safety Executive’s (HSE) online forms.
more_information:
- England, Wales and Scotland only - when you’ve sent the form, a copy will be emailed back to you for your records - only businesses should report incidents to the HSE - if you’re an employee or member of the public, you should tell the business where the incident happened ## Other ways to report You can report fatal or major injuries by phone. $C **HSE Incident Control Centre** 0845 300 9923
Monday to Friday 8.30am to 5.00pm $C ###Northern Ireland - how to report You must report to the [Health and Safety Executive Northern Ireland.](http://www.hseni.gov.uk/contact-us/report-an-incident.htm “Reporting an accident or health and safety incident in Northern Ireland”){:rel=”external”} *[HSE]: Health and Safety Executive
overview: Report accidents at work, near misses and work-related illnesses and diseases using the Health and Safety Executive’s (HSE) online forms
title: Report an accident or health and safety incident at work
will_continue_on: the Health and Safety Executive website
